title: Looking for a typeface with a typical curved E
content:
I can’t seem to remember where I’ve seen a curved E before (although I’m sure I’ve seen it recently). I attempted to draw the character as best as possible. Does anyone know what typeface or typefaces have a similar glyph? Thanks.

 ![](files/Curl E_4079.jpg)
author: auricfuzz

comments.content: I found one possibility, Jeremy Tankard’s [Shire Shropshire](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133901/http:/www.typography.net/type/shires.htm), but I feel like the font I seek is lighter and straighter, like the sample I drew.

[Democratica](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133901/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=E.6913.0.0) from Emigre; [Percolator from T-26](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133901/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=C.100897.0.0).

There are others, I am still looking.

- Mike Yanega

lighter and straigher…also Jeremy Tankard’s Alchemy but it’s another world maybe  
or maybe Sansa by OurType [www.ourtype.be](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133901/http:/www.ourtype.be/)

[Envision](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133901/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/envision/) from T-26 is another.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks, Mike and Paolo. Unfortunately, none of those seems exactly what I’m looking for (Sansa is closest). I feel like I’ve seen a letter just about as unadorned as the one I drew. Thinking more, the character might have been an alternate E. Unless I made up this character, in which case, yay! But I doubt it.
could it be FS Sophie by fontshmith?
Nope, never seen FS Sophie before. I’m thinking that I’m essentially remembering the E’s from Tankard’s Shropshire and Cheshire, as I’ve been looking at those fonts lately. Thanks for all the help.
